Q.Question1: To celebrate her year end bonus, Megyn is thinking of spending some of her earnings on gambling. She thought of spending it on a chance based game like _________________.

Option1.info: This is correct! Roulette is a chance based game, so as slots!

Option2.info: This is correct! Slots is a chance based game, so as Roulette!

Option1.info: This is correct! Chance based games are purely random

Q.Question3: which means that the odds of winning _________________ each time you play.

Option1.info: This is correct! The odds of winning never changes in chance based games.

Q.Question4: She also thought about spending it on a skill based game like _________________.

Option1.info: This is correct! Poker is a skill based game, so as a horse race betting.

Q.Question5: However, she understands that _________________ the outcome of the game.

Option1.info: Oops, she can’t affect the outcome of the game. Skill and strategy can play a role in these games, but you still don't control the cards that are being dealt or the outcome of an event that is being waged.

Option3.info: Oops, she can’t get tips. Skill and strategy can play a role in these games, but you still don't control the cards that are being dealt or the outcome of an event that is being waged.

Option4.info: Oops, she can’t get insights. Skill and strategy can play a role in these games, but you still don't control the cards that are being dealt or the outcome of an event that is being waged.

Q.Question6: She finally decided on buying a Lotto Max ticket, even though a _________________ ticket had better odds of winning.

Option3.info: This is correct! Scratch and win has better odds of winning than a Lotto Max ticket.
